She is a survivor. She had an interview with Chris Hansen as well as pastel belle.
EDIT
Here‚Äôs the [Chris Hansen interview ](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=SYfkXcSB9ho)

Ok, I really really enjoyed hearing Ash and Nikki as well as Mel. However, I have mixed feelings about Chris Hansen. I feel like near the end he was trying to make a point about not blaming folks like Jeffree, jay, and Fallon. That being said, it came off as hella preachy. I think those folks SHOULD be held accountable even if they were victims/survivors themselves. I 100% believe Fallon was full of shit, and I believe she saw a lot more than she said in her interview. It feels like her and others spoke to a lawyer before hand and were like ‚Äúok what can I say?‚Äù 
I think of the onision case with Kai. Kai was a survivor, BUT, that does not negate that he was complicit in gurg‚Äôs crimes.
Mel said that jayy has been helpful, but he really doesn‚Äôt come off that way on his instagram. Someone asked him the other day: ‚Äúare you going to tell the truth?‚Äù And he responded that he already had told the truth. Yes, was Jayy a survivor? Absolutely, however, I think people who were around Jesus Torres need to speak up even if it puts them in a bad light. 
Again, I am not a survivor, but I want justice for these children. I am not here for drama or tea, I‚Äôm here to see this man go to prison. 
I respect the hell out of Chris Hansen, he‚Äôs done a pretty good job at bringing this stuff to light. However, I still think I can remain critical of his actions. Repzilla made a good video on this.

I agree with you and others on this. While Belle is coming from a good place, I was turned off by her blind support of Fallon and belittling commentators who spoke up on this. It irked me because I personally believe Fallon knew a lot more than she was letting on.

I was seething the entire interview. J*‚Äôs manipulation techniques he used during the interview (calling Chris by his name, directing the questions away by being like ‚Äúlet‚Äôs talk about this‚Äù) were honestly so gross. And his rich white ass being like ‚Äústart a go fund me to help survivors!!‚Äù I‚Äôm like bitch you should do that, J* is a millionaire and actually can afford to support survivors financially, BUT HE DOESNT. 
Also he made the entire interview about himself, near the end he was just promoting his business and who he is. 
He also accepted 0 accountability to what he saw when touring with dahvie. The use of the word ‚Äúmisinterpretation‚Äù was rampant in the interview, an effective way to gaslight the audience. 
Watched Damien (j slaughter)‚Äôs live stream on Instagram while watching the interview, I feel so bad for them having to watch this shit unfold. Like Damien said ‚Äúthis is not about drama or clout, this is about figuring out what happened to me as a child‚Äù

Hugs and validation 
I‚Äôm going through a similar situation currently. My long time best friend and I are on the outs because I lashed out at her because I too was in fear of abandonment. I was quite childish, and I do regret some of the things I said. However, I also am thinking because of my illness because of who I am her and I are not going to be close friends anymore. Perhaps ‚Äúfriends‚Äù but not close. Long story short, I am sorry I don‚Äôt have any solid advice for you, I just can say I feel you and there are many other cool ass people out there to be friends with who understand and have unconditional compassion. 
Much love to you during this time.
